body.p:
Mt sterling Ky Jany 19. 1861.
To the Governor of Kentucky,

Dear sir you will remember on the 16 Inst I. presented, a petition for the pardon of Stephen Hensley (who is in the penitentiary for two years) for false swearing) and asked you to suspend any action on the petition untill I sent you a copy of the records, that you might See the whole case, that Record I now herewith send you: You can see How readily an illiterate ignorant man might have been inocently mistaken; that he was so his conduct before the Justice shows.
This mans family stand in great need of his services & If consistent with your Judgment of propriety I hope you will pardon him & send him home to his family.
The public interest cannot suffer I think by his release

Your obt. servt
Tho. F. Hazelrigg

His Excellency
Governor of Ky
Frankfort
